message: If I do a :wa to save all open buffers, and have one or two buffers which are just scratch kind and I don't indent to save, then :wa does not work
what I intend is to save all the non-scratch files
is there any command or say, vim-tip to help me with this?
I think it depends how are you defining "scratch file". If you really don't care about them how are you creating them? `:wa!` will usually just save all that it can and not complain.
ok, I can use :wa! to save as many and not complain, but how does it handle files that have been modified externally?
usually its the buffer I end up with when I open vim, or when I do a :enew
I think you would benefit  by taking a look at `:help wa` - Vim will warn you if you try to overwrite a file that has been changed elsewhere.
